original_text:
Fowl Play Centurion
Chiunque si sia avvicinato alle slot machine in Italia, magari con un primo timido approccio in un bar o in una sala giochi, ricorderà la slot Fowl Play. Slot italiana in cui c’era la famosa gallina dalle uova d’oro: questo titolo fu talmente fortunato, che la WMG (la casa di sviluppo) ha rilasciato nel tempo diverse varianti e spin off, tra cui Fowl Play Centurion di cui andremo a parlare nella recensione di oggi.
Fowl Play Centurion – Ave Cesare
Cominciamo parlando del comparto grafico: Fowl Play Centurion porta con sé tutti i protagonisti della serie Fowl Play e li cala all’interno di un’ambientazione romana.
Ecco quindi che nella griglia di gioco collocata tra due colonne in marmo troviamo la volpe, le galline e il gallo, insieme ad altri elementi a metà tra la società romana e il cortile (il covone di fieno e i sesterzi d’oro).
La WMG, ancora una volta, fa della semplicità il suo marchio di fabbrica, di fatto offrendo la stessa slot che abbiamo imparato ad amare ma vestendola con un nuovo costume per renderla più fresca e innovativa.
La musica offre un jingle orchestrale a ogni giocata, rendendo ancora più epica l’ambientazione del gioco.
Ma vediamo cosa ha da offrirci questo titolo da un punto di vista tecnico.
Fowl Play Centurion – Meccaniche di gioco
Così come possiamo aspettarci da una slot di taglio classico come quelle della serie Fowl Play, anche Centurion segue i canoni che ormai ben conosciamo.
Ci troviamo infatti di fronte a una griglia di gioco di tipo 5*3, condivisa dalla maggior parte dei titoli online, che mostra quindici simboli a ogni giocata divisi in tre su ognuno dei cinque rulli.
L’RTP, ovvero la percentuale di ritorno per giocatore (percentuale di soldi emessi in forma di vincita rispetto a quelli inseriti come giocata) è del 90%, un valore inferiore rispetto ad altri titoli internazionali ma decisamente superiore rispetto alla prima Fowl Play.
La Volatilità è media, possiamo quindi aspettarci un giusto compromesso tra giocate prive di vincita e giocate vincenti, sebbene siano più rari i premi fuori dal comune.
Due sono i simboli a cui dobbiamo prestare attenzione: la Gallina Bianca è un simbolo Scatter che permette di accedere alla modalità bonus trovandone uno su ogni rullo in una sola giocata, mentre la Volpe Centurione è un simbolo Wild, ovvero un jolly che può sostituire tutti gli altri simboli (a parte il Bonus) in gioco.
La modalità bonus si divide in due fasi: nella prima vedrai girare uno scudo per decidere la modalità tra Testudo Battle e Arena of Valor, entrambi bonus in cui dovremo selezionare un premio casuale.
Slot simili a Fowl Play Centurion
Come abbiamo detto in precedenza, le slot a tema Fowl Play sono diverse, tra cui: Fowl Play Gold, 4 Fowl Play e Fowl Play London (in cui abbiamo un’ambientazione che omaggia Sherlock Holmes), tutte della WMG.

raw_translation.response:
Fowl Play Centurion - A Review for Experienced Gamblers

If you have ever laid your hands on slot machines in Italy, perhaps timidly trying your luck at a bar or arcade, then you're likely to remember the infamous Fowl Play slot game. The game featured a famous golden egg-laying hen and became so popular that its development house, WMG, has since released several variations and spin-offs, including Fowl Play Centurion, which we shall review today.

Fowl Play Centurion - Ave Cesare

Let's begin by discussing the game's graphics: Fowl Play Centurion brings all the characters from the Fowl Play series to a Roman setting. In the game's matrix, located between two marble columns, players can find the fox, hens, and rooster, along with other elements from both Roman society and the courtyard (hay bale and gold sesterces).

Once again, WMG keeps it simple and makes it their trademark. Fowl Play Centurion is essentially the same beloved slot, dressed in a new costume to make it fresh and innovative.

The music adds an orchestral jingle to each spin, further enhancing the game's epic ambiance. But let's examine what this release offers from a technical standpoint.

Fowl Play Centurion - Gameplay Mechanics

As one would expect from a classic slot game like the Fowl Play series, Centurion follows the conventional playbook. It features a 5x3 game matrix, shared by most online titles, displaying fifteen symbols on each spin, divided into three on all five reels.

The RTP, or player return percentage (the percentage of money issued as winnings relative to that wagered), stands at 90%, lower than international titles but substantially higher than that of the original Fowl Play. The volatility is medium, suggesting a fair compromise between spins without winnings and winning ones, though extraordinary prizes are rarely won.

Two symbols require our attention: the White Hen, a scatter symbol that triggers the bonus mode when one appears on each reel in one spin, while the Centurion Fox is a wild symbol, meaning it is a joker that replaces all other symbols (except the Bonus) in the game.

The bonus mode has two phases: the first involves selecting between Testudo Battle and Arena of Valor modes by spinning a shield. In both modes, players must choose a random prize.

Slots Similar to Fowl Play Centurion

As previously mentioned, there are several Fowl Play-themed slots, including Fowl Play Gold, 4 Fowl Play, and Fowl Play London (paying homage to Sherlock Holmes), all by WMG.

Graphics

Fowl Play Centurion offers a fresh and innovative take on the classic Fowl Play series by dressing it up in a new costume. The characters and elements are set in a Roman backdrop, with a game grid placed between two marble columns. The music adds to the epic player experience with an orchestral jingle on every bet.

Bonus Mode

Fowl Play Centurion has a bonus mode that is triggered by finding a White Hen Scatter symbol on each reel in a single bet. The bonus mode is divided into two phases: Testudo Battle and the Arena of Valor, both of which offer a random prize.

RTP and Volatility

The RTP of Fowl Play Centurion is 90%, which is lower than some international titles but higher than the first Fowl Play. The volatility is medium, offering a fair compromise between non-winning and winning bets. Unusual prizes are somewhat rare.

Symbols

Fowl Play Centurion has two important symbols - the White Hen Scatter symbol and the Centurion Fox Wild symbol. The White Hen triggers the bonus mode, while the Centurion Fox substitutes for all other symbols (except the Bonus symbol) in the game.

Review: Fowl Play Centurion Review:
For those who have approached slot machines in Italy, perhaps with a timid first approach in a bar or arcade, they will surely remember the slot Fowl Play. This Italian slot machine featured the famous golden egg-laying chicken, and the title was so successful that the WMG (the developer) released several variants and spin-offs over time, including Fowl Play Centurion which we will talk about in today's review.

Fowl Play Centurion - Ave Cesare
Let's start by talking about the graphics: Fowl Play Centurion brings all the characters from the Fowl Play series and drops them into a Roman setting. So, we find the fox, the hens, the rooster, along with other elements halfway between Roman society and the courtyard (the haystack and golden sesterces), on a game grid placed between two marble columns.

Once again, the WMG makes simplicity their trademark, effectively offering the same slot that we have learned to love but dressing it up in a new costume to make it fresher and more innovative. The music offers an orchestral jingle every bet, making the player's experience more epic.

But let's see what this title has to offer us from a technical point of view.

Fowl Play Centurion - Gameplay Mechanics
As we can expect from a classic slot machine like those in the Fowl Play series, Centurion follows the established canon.

In fact, we find ourselves facing a game grid of the 5 * 3 type, shared by most online titles, which shows fifteen symbols on each bet divided into three on each of the five reels.

The RTP, or player return percentage (percentage of money issued in winnings compared to that inserted as bets), is 90%, a lower value than other international titles but significantly higher than the first Fowl Play. The volatility is medium, so we can expect a fair compromise between bets without a win and winning bets, although unusual prizes are rarer.

There are two symbols that we need to pay attention to: the White Hen is a Scatter symbol that allows access to the bonus mode by finding one on each reel in a single bet, while the Centurion Fox is a Wild symbol, a joker that can replace all other symbols (except for the Bonus) in the game.

The bonus mode is divided into two phases: in the first, you will see a shield spin to decide between Testudo Battle and the Arena of Valor, both bonuses in which we must select a random prize.

Similar slots to Fowl Play Centurion
As we said before, Fowl Play-themed slots are different, including: Fowl Play Gold, 4 Fowl Play, and Fowl Play London (where we have a setting that pays homage to Sherlock Holmes), all from the WMG.
